meanings.definition: An object with two glass bulbs connected by a narrow neck, used to measure time.
meanings.sent1: The hourglass on the teacher's desk helped students track the time for their exam.
meanings.sent2: She turned the hourglass over to start timing the game.
meanings.sent3: When the hourglass ran out, it was like a signal for the end of the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The hourglass seemed to mock him as it counted down the seconds.
meanings.sent5: The hourglass's sand slipping through the neck was a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.sent1: Her dress hugged her body, giving her an hourglass figure.
meanings.sent2: The vase had an hourglass shape, tapering in the middle.
meanings.sent3: The hourglass design of the building made it stand out among the rest.
meanings.sent4: The road curved in an hourglass pattern, narrowing at the center.
meanings.sent5: The necklace's pendant was crafted in an elegant hourglass form.
